page.title: 20Shopping: Pateley
page.content: Most of the shop buildings in Pateley Bridge date back to the last century and run up both sides of the High Street. There is a reasonable variety of shops such as a glass engraver, a gun shop, a watchmaker and a shop where enamelled jewellery is made. There is an ironmonger's shop, which sells kitchen hardware and tools.Two small supermarkets sell a wide range of food and household necessities. One shop supplies everything for dress- making such as patterns, zips and fabric. There are three hairdressers, which are quite well attended by the local folk. A small chemist deals with doctors' prescriptions and sells herbs, ointments and alcoholic drinks. The one shoe shop also sells fishing tackle and licences for fishing on the river Nidd. The two butchers also sell game, poultry and homemade pies.
